title: Norman Humphries
text:
Norman Hampton Humphries (19 May 1917 – 18 December 2000) was an English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er who played <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> for <a href="Worcestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Worcestershire</a> in 1946. He also played <a href="minor%20counties">minor counties</a> cricket for <a href="Devon%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Devon</a> between 1938 and 1955.
Humphries made his debut near the end of June 1946, against <a href="Warwickshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Warwickshire</a> at <a href="Edgbaston%20Cricket%20Ground">Edgbaston</a>, and scored 21 in his only innings.
After making 3 in the first innings of his next game, against <a href="Glamorgan%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Glamorgan</a>, he showed quite some consistency, his next five innings being 22, 16, 17, 22 and 16.
However, he was unable to break through and produce a significant score, and after this one season he was never again to appear at first-class level.
For Devon, however, it could be a different story, and in June 1949 Humphries produced his finest form. First he hit 199 against <a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent</a> II,
and immediately thereafter he struck 216 <a href="not%20out">not out</a>, <a href="carry%20the%20bat">carrying his bat</a> against <a href="Surrey%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Surrey</a> II. By coincidence, in this game <a href="Alan%20Brazier">Alan Brazier</a> made 216 not out in Surrey II's own first innings!
Two brothers, <a href="Cedric%20Humphries">Cedric</a> and <a href="Gerald%20Humphries">Gerald</a>, also played for Worcestershire.
